SEARCH
Package com.kneelawk.knet.api.util

Class NetBufs

java.lang.Object
com.kneelawk.knet.api.util.NetBufs
public final class NetBufs extends Object
Utility methods for working with KNet buffers.

Net buffer class hierarchy: 

               FriendlyByteBuf
                 /         \
   RegistryFriendlyByteBuf      NetByteBuf
              |               |
 NetRegistryByteBuf<->RegistryNetByteBuf
See Also:
  • NetBuf
  • NetByteBuf
  • RegistryNetByteBuf
  • NetRegistryByteBuf

      Parameters:
      registryManager - the registry manager to attach.
      Returns:
      the function that wraps buffers.

    • netBuf

      public static NetByteBuf netBuf()
      Creates a new NetByteBuf without any initial capacity.
      Returns:
      A new NetByteBuf from Unpooled.buffer()

    • netBuf

      public static NetByteBuf netBuf(int initialCapacity)
      Creates a new NetByteBuf with the given initial capacity.
      Parameters:
      initialCapacity - the buffer's initial capacity.
      Returns:
      A new NetByteBuf from Unpooled.buffer(int)

    • netBuf

      public static NetByteBuf netBuf(boolean passthrough)
      Creates a new NetByteBuf without any initial capacity while optionally disabling optimizations.
      Parameters:
      passthrough - whether to disable optimizations.
      Returns:
      A new NetByteBuf from Unpooled.buffer()

    • netBuf

      public static NetByteBuf netBuf(int initialCapacity, boolean passthrough)
      Creates a new NetByteBuf with the given initial capacity while optionally disabling optimizations.
      Parameters:
      initialCapacity - the buffer's initial capacity.
      passthrough - whether to disable optimizations.
      Returns:
      A new NetByteBuf from Unpooled.buffer(int)

    • netOf

      public static NetByteBuf netOf(io.netty.buffer.ByteBuf buf)
      Returns the given ByteBuf as NetByteBuf. If the given instance is already a NetByteBuf then the given buffer is returned.

      Note: read/write boolean/fixed-bits being called on the underlying buffer does not update this buffer's partials. Try to only read/write to a single buffer at a time.

      Parameters:
      buf - the buffer to be converted into a NetByteBuf.
      Returns:
      the given buffer as a NetByteBuf.

    • netOf

      public static NetByteBuf netOf(io.netty.buffer.ByteBuf buf, boolean passthrough)
      Returns the given ByteBuf as NetByteBuf, but with passthrough mode enabled. If the given instance is already a NetByteBuf then the given buffer is returned.

      Note: read/write boolean/fixed-bits being called on the underlying buffer does not update this buffer's partials. Try to only read/write to a single buffer at a time.

      Parameters:
      buf - the buffer to be converted into a NetByteBuf.
      passthrough - whether to disable optimizations on the resulting buffer.
      Returns:
      the given buffer as a NetByteBuf.

    • registryNetBuf

      public static RegistryNetByteBuf registryNetBuf(net.minecraft.core.RegistryAccess registryManager)
      Creates a new RegistryNetByteBuf without any initial capacity.
      Parameters:
      registryManager - the registry manager to attach to the buffer.
      Returns:
      a new RegistryNetByteBuf from Unpooled.buffer().

    • registryNetBuf

      public static RegistryNetByteBuf registryNetBuf(int initialCapacity, net.minecraft.core.RegistryAccess registryManager)
      Creates a new RegistryNetByteBuf without any initial capacity.
      Parameters:
      initialCapacity - the buffer's initial capacity.
      registryManager - the registry manager to attach to the buffer.
      Returns:
      a new RegistryNetByteBuf from Unpooled.buffer().

    • registryNetOf

      public static RegistryNetByteBuf registryNetOf(net.minecraft.network.RegistryFriendlyByteBuf buf)
      Returns the given RegistryFriendlyByteBuf as a NetByteBuf.

      Note: read/write boolean/fixed-bits being called on the underlying buffer does not update this buffer's partials. Try to only read/write to a single buffer at a time.

      Parameters:
      buf - the buffer to be converted into a NetByteBuf.
      Returns:
      the given buffer as a NetByteBuf.

    • registryNetOf

      public static RegistryNetByteBuf registryNetOf(net.minecraft.network.RegistryFriendlyByteBuf buf, boolean passthrough)
      Returns the given RegistryFriendlyByteBuf as a NetByteBuf, with passthrough optionally enabled.

      Note: read/write boolean/fixed-bits being called on the underlying buffer does not update this buffer's partials. Try to only read/write to a single buffer at a time.

      Parameters:
      buf - the buffer to be converted into a NetByteBuf.
      passthrough - whether to disable optimizations on the resulting buffer.
      Returns:
      the given buffer as a NetByteBuf.

      Parameters:
      buf - the buffer to be converted into a NetByteBuf.

    • registryNetOf

      public static RegistryNetByteBuf registryNetOf(io.netty.buffer.ByteBuf buf, net.minecraft.core.RegistryAccess registryManager)
      Returns the given ByteBuf as a RegistryNetByteBuf, attaching a registry manager.

      Note: read/write boolean/fixed-bits being called on the underlying buffer does not update this buffer's partials. Try to only read/write to a single buffer at a time.

      Parameters:
      buf - the buffer to be converted into a RegistryNetByteBuf.
      registryManager - the registry manager to attach.
      Returns:
      the given buffer as a RegistryNetByteBuf.

    • registryNetOf

      public static RegistryNetByteBuf registryNetOf(io.netty.buffer.ByteBuf buf, boolean passthrough, net.minecraft.core.RegistryAccess registryManager)
      Returns the given ByteBuf as a RegistryNetByteBuf, attaching a registry manager, but with passthrough optionally enabled.

      Note: read/write boolean/fixed-bits being called on the underlying buffer does not update this buffer's partials. Try to only read/write to a single buffer at a time.

      Parameters:
      buf - the buffer to be converted into a RegistryNetByteBuf.
      passthrough - whether to disable optimizations on the resulting buffer.
      registryManager - the registry manager to attach.
      Returns:
      the given buffer as a RegistryNetByteBuf.

      Returns:
      the new buffer.

    • netRegistryOf

      public static NetRegistryByteBuf netRegistryOf(net.minecraft.network.RegistryFriendlyByteBuf buf)
      Wraps a RegistryFriendlyByteBuf into a NetRegistryByteBuf.

      Note: read/write boolean/fixed-bits being called on the underlying buffer does not update this buffer's partials. Try to only read/write to a single buffer at a time.

      Parameters:
      buf - the original buffer.
      Returns:
      the wrapping buffer.

      Note: read/write boolean/fixed-bits being called on the underlying buffer does not update this buffer's partials. Try to only read/write to a single buffer at a time.

      Parameters:
      buf - the original buffer.
      passthrough - whether to disable optimizations.
      Returns:
      the wrapping buffer.

    • netRegistryOf

      public static NetRegistryByteBuf netRegistryOf(io.netty.buffer.ByteBuf buf, net.minecraft.core.RegistryAccess registryManager, boolean passthrough)
      Wraps a ByteBuf into a NetRegistryByteBuf, attaching the given registry manager and with passthrough optionally enabled.

      Note: read/write boolean/fixed-bits being called on the underlying buffer does not update this buffer's partials. Try to only read/write to a single buffer at a time.

      Parameters:
      buf - the original buffer.
      registryManager - the registry manager to attach.
      passthrough - whether to disable optimizations.
      Returns:
      the wrapping buffer.
